did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Van Breed Hart Tompkins County accounts, 1830-1880.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Blacksmith's accounts of Cortland Wheeler, Dryden, New York; Peruville, New York cheese factory lading accounts; general store accounts of E.B. Hill; and distillery accounts, owner unknown.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Blacksmith's accounts of Cortland Wheeler, Dryden, New York; Peruville, New York cheese factory lading accounts; general store accounts of E.B. Hill; and distillery accounts, owner unknown.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Van Breed Hart Tompkins County accounts, #1974. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Became property of his wife's nephew, George E. Monroe of Dryden, N.Y. (wife's name: Annette Edgcomb of West Dryden, N.Y.). Apparently later used as a scrapbook, the first 1/3 of the account book contains mounted newspaper clippings of prominent men and women.

did.unittitle: Peruville Cheese Factory Lading Account Book, 1869

scopecontent.p: An account book covering the purchase of milk, conversion into cheese, and the sale of that cheese. Name E.E. Ellis inside front cover.

did.unittitle: The volume contains several apparently isolated records. There is no indication as to location. The entries are in the following order:

scopecontent.p: 4 pp. - E.B. Hill - goods bought from various companies and prices paid. The list of goods seems to indicate that E.B. Hill owned a General Store; dated 1848, New York.
3 pp. - Articles of Agreement between Ezra G. Beach and Eli hakes permitting Hakes to cut and take timber from property belonging to Beach, 1859.
1 page - titled Day Book 1880 indicates establishment of partnership between Wm (?) Jonas, Thomas Mason and George F. Smith as dealers in furniture.
3 pp. - titled Sales Book 1880 - furniture sales.
2 pp. - titled Cash - shows cash receipts and expenses, June and July
Balance of book is blank except for one page towards the back set up as a time sheet.

did.unittitle: Cover reads: Merchants Farmers & Mechanics Acc't. Book 1831

scopecontent.p: Title on cover and date do not pertain to contents of the volume (but do serve to identify it); no clearly identifying names or locations given but Tompkins County Court Session Notices pasted in; name Boynton mentioned.
Entries cover whiskey sold; stock, produce, grain bought; work done; pasturage charges; wood bought; other miscellaneous items.
